ovdesc.p: This file holds all security positions which have been repo'd out of the Bank's own book(s).

desc.p: The key of the REPO.POSITION file is made up of seven elements separated by dots. These elements are; Portfolio Number Security Number Depository Nominee Code Maturity Date Interest Rate Sub Account
Note: The Maturity Date and Interest Rate are only included in the key if the Sub Asset Type of the Security is flagged as a KassenObligationen security.
If this repo position is held by Nominee then this field will contain the ID of the Nominee. If this position is not held by nominee then this field will be blank.
Must be the key to a valid entry on the NOMINEE.CODE file.
This field contains the Security Number that the Repo Position is for.
Must be the key to a valid entry on the SECURITY.MASTER file.
This field contains the Depository where the Repo Position is held.
It must be valid T24 Customer and is setup as a depository on the CUSTOMER.SECURITY file.
Standard T24 customer field.
Must be the key to a valid entry on the CUSTOMER file.
This field holds the issue date of the secruity.
Standard T24 date field.
The field contains the sub account where the Repo Position is held.
It must be a valid sub account in CUSTOMER.SECURITY record keyed on the depository.
No-input field
Optional field
This is the portfolio that the repo position is for.
Must be the key to a valid entry on the SEC.ACC.MASTER file.

This field is only updated if this repo position is for a Kassenobligationen security. A Kassenobligationen security is one where the Sub Asset Type record linked to the security has the KASSENOBLIGATIONEN flag set to YES.
Standard T24 date field.
Multi-value field that contains the nominal amount on which the REPO contract is done.
The same process is done for the RESO contract.
No-input field.
Opening Balance - in number of securities - for this repo position.
This field will always be zero unless it has been updated by the takeover processing when T24 was first installed on the system.
Standard T24 amount field.
This field contains the Trade Date of the last transaction to update this Repo Position Record.
Standard T24 date field.

This field is only updated if this repo position is for a Kassenobligationen security. A Kassenobligationen security is one where the Sub Asset Type record linked to the security has the KASSENOBLIGATIONEN flag set to YES.

If the security identified in the SECURITY.NUMBER is a Kassenobligationen security then this will be the interest rate for the security - taken from the INTEREST.RATE field on the Security Master record.
Standard T24 rate field.
This field contains the trade dated number of securities repo'd out of the Bank's own book(s).
Standard T24 amount field. (1 - 18 characters)
Multi-value field that contains the contract id on which the REPO contract is done.
The same process is done for the RESO contracts.
No-input field.
Multi-value field that contains the traded price on which the REPO contract is done.
The same process is done for the RESO contracts.
No-input field.
Multi-value field that contains the portfolio number on which the REPO contract is done.
The suffix is determined by the REPO.MARGIN.SUF value in REPO.PARAMETER file.
The same process is done for the RESO contract.
No-input field
